projectPurpose: To provide a functional and feature-rich VPN client for Linux users to connect to Palo Alto Networks GlobalProtect VPNs, offering an alternative to the official Linux client with enhanced support for modern authentication methods like SSO and MFA.
mainFeatures: Supports SSO with MFA, Yubikey, and client certificates
Available as a free CLI version and a paid GUI version

alternatives.name: GlobalProtect App for Linux (Official)
mainFeatures: Provides secure access to corporate networks
Available in CLI and GUI versions
alternatives.website: Typically provided by IT department or Palo Alto Networks support portal

alternatives.name: OpenConnect
mainFeatures: VPN client for GlobalProtect, AnyConnect, FortiGate, etc.

alternatives.name: OpenVPN
mainFeatures: Widely used for site-to-site and client-server VPNs

alternatives.name: Cisco Secure Client (AnyConnect)
mainFeatures: Supports VPN and other security modules

alternatives.name: Pritunl Client
mainFeatures: Open source OpenVPN and WireGuard client

marketPositioning: GlobalProtect-openconnect is positioned as a vital third-party, open-source GlobalProtect VPN client specifically for the Linux ecosystem. It addresses the need for a reliable and feature-rich client on Linux distributions where the official Palo Alto Networks client may be difficult to obtain, unsupported, or lack specific features like robust SSO/MFA support. By building upon OpenConnect and offering a modern GUI with Tauri (in its paid version), it provides a user-friendly experience that complements or replaces the command-line OpenConnect and offers broader compatibility and authentication features than potentially outdated official Linux clients.
